equal.description: Returns true if the country has at least X absolutism. [Country]
Returns true if the country accepts the specified culture. [Country]
Returns true if X is the current mission ot the country. [Country]
Returns true if the country has at least X administrative power. [Country]
Returns true if the country has an administrative technology of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has an advisor of the specified type. [Country]
Returns true if the advisor X exists. [Country]
Returns true if the country is controlled by the AI. [Country]
Returns true if the country has an alliance with X. [Country]
Returns true if females can become emperor. [Anywhere]
Returns true under all circumstances if set to yes, returns false under all circumstances if set to no. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the province is part of the area X. [Province]
Returns true if the country has an army of at least X k soldiers. [Country]
Returns true if the total army size of the country is at least X% of its land force limit. [Country]
Returns true if the country's army professionalism is of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has an army tradition of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the ratio of the artillery fraction to the army size of the country is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if there are at least X artillery units in the province. [Province]
Returns true if the country is at war with any country of a different religion. [Country]
Returns true if the Inti country has at least X authority. [Country]
Returns true if the country has an average autonomy in its provinces of at least X. [Country]
[Country]
[Country]
Returns true if the country has an average autonomy in its provinces excluding overseas provinces is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has an average unrest in its provinces of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the base manpower of the province is at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the base production of the province is at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the base tax of the province is at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the blockade penalty of the country is at least X%. [Country]
Returns true, if country meets the conditions defined in the subject type's is_potential_overlord section. [Country]
Returns true if the specified building can be built in the province. [Province]
Returns true if the country can create a vassal. Warning: Interprets anything after ‘=’ as “yes”. Note: Works only for independent countries. [Country]
Returns true if the country’s heir can potentially be the consort’s child. [Country]
Returns true if the country can justify a trade conflict against country X. [Country]
Returns true if the specified rebel faction is a valid rebel faction of the province. [Province]
Returns true if the country's capital is the province with the ID X. [Country]
Returns true if trade node capital is X [Region]
Returns true if the ratio of the cavalry fraction to the army size of the country is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if there are at least X cavalry units in the province. [Province]
Returns true if the province has a center of trade of at least this level. [Province]
Returns true if the country has at least X church power. [Country]
Returns true if the country is the target of a coalition. [Country]
Returns true if ... has gotten a colonial grant for the scope's colonial region from any potential pope-like entities.
Returns true if the province is part of the colonial region X. [Province]
Returns true if country has at least that many colonial subjects. [Country]
Returns true if country has claim on colony [Country]
Returns true if colony is at least size X. [Province]
Returns true if the country has a consort with an administrative skill of at least X. [Country]

Returns true if the country has a consort with an diplomatic skill of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a consort with an military skill of at least X. [Country]
Returns true, if the country's consort has the specified culture. Can utilise Event Scope Values. [Country]
Returns true, if the country's consort has the specified religion. Can utilise Event Scope Values. [Country]
Returns true if the country’s consort has the specified personality. [Country]
Returns true if the construction progress is at least X%. [Province]
Returns true if the province is located on continent X. [Province]
Returns true if the province is controlled by X. [Province]
Returns true if the province with id X is controlled by the country. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a core on any province owned by country X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has cored at least X% of its provinces. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a corruption of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the province is part of the specified country or its subjects. [Province]
Returns true if the province culture is X. [Province]
Returns true if the country/province has a culture of the specified culture group. [Country / Province]

Returns true if the parliament of the country debates about X. [Country]
Returns true, if the country has the specified (orthodox) icon. [Country]

Returns true if the parliament of the country has a least X seats. [Country]

Returns true if the country has a government rank of X or higher. [Country]

Returns true if the country has a great power rank of 2 or worse. [Country]
Returns true if the country is guaranteed by X. [Country]
Returns true if the country fought a war within the last X years. [Country]

Returns true if the country has activated a fervor effect. [Country]
Returns true if country has the specified policy active. [Country]
Returns true if the country has adopted the specified cult. [Country]
Returns true if the country has hired an advisor. Warning: Inteprets every right side argument as yes . [Country]
Returns true, if the country has the specified age ability. [Country]
Returns true if the country borders any country of a different religion. Warning: Interprets anything after ‘=’ as “yes”. [Country]

Returns true if the country has a consort. [Country]

Returns true if the country has a consort regency. [Country]

Returns true if there is the specified construction in progress in the province. Possible values are core, culture, building, merchant, diplomat, missionary, army, navy, canal, great_project etc. [Province]

Returns true if country has been force-converted via either religious rebels or an Enforce Religion peace treaty. Note: The subject interaction Enforce Religion does not cause the subject to be considered as force-converted. [Country]

Returns true if the country has at least X strong trade companies. [Country]
Returns true if the country is the overlord of at least X subject countries of any type. [Country]
Returns true, if the country has at least X territories (areas that aren't states). [Country]
Returns true if the development of the province was improved at least X times. [Province]
Returns true if the country owns at least X total ports (anywhere in the world). [Country]
Returns true if the country has at least X trade embargos. [Country]
Returns true if the country hasat least X ‘trading in’ bonuses. [Country]
Returns true if the country has at least X transports. [Country]
Returns true if the country has at least X allies with 100 trust. [Country]
Returns true if the country has at least X personal unions. [Country]
Returns true if the country has unlocked at least X cults. [Country]
Returns true if the country receives war reparations from at least X countries. [Country]
Returns true if country has at least X ships privateering. [Country]
Returns true if the country is in an offensive war with country X. [Country]
Returns true if country has at least X% overextension. [Country]
Returns true if the country is the overlord of X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has X percentage of overseas provinces. [Country]
Returns true if the province is owned by the country X. [Province]
Returns true if the country owns the specified province. [Country]
Returns true if the country owns and has a core on the specified province. [Country]
Returns true, if the country or a subject that is not categorized as "sovereign" (e.g. tributary states are excluded) owns the specified province. [Country]
Returns true, if the country or a subject owns the specified province. [Country]
Returns true if the papacy is active. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the country's papal influence is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country's patriarch authority is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if at least the Xth part of the seats in the parliament is backing for the current issue. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a ruler which personality is X. [Country]
Returns true if the country's piety is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if an elector has the country X is the preferred emperor. [Country (Elector)]
Return true if the country has a prestige of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the previous owner of the province was X. [Province]
Returns true if the country's primary culture is X. [Country]
Returns true if the country is primitive. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a production efficiency of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the ratio of production income to total income is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the province has the ID X. [Province]
Returns true if the province belongs to the specified province group. [Province]
Returns true if trade power generated by the province is at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the country has a province on the continent with the capital of the specified country. [Country]
Returns true if the province has a base unrest of at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the province is within the range of the specified country. [Province]
Returns true, if today is X. Refers to the actual real day (probably takes system time). [Anywhere]
Returns true if the month of the year in reality is at least X (January &#8793 [0)]
Returns true if the reform desire is at least X%. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the province is part of the region X. [Province]

Returns true if the country/province has religion X. Note: Within province scope religion = secondary returns true if the province religion matches the secondary/syncretic religion of the owner. [Country / Province]
Returns true if the country/province has a religion of the specified religious group. [Country / Province]
Returns true if the country has the same religion as country X [Region]
Returns true if the country's religious unity is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if country's republican tradition is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if country's revanchism is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if at least the Xth part of the provinces of the country have revolts. [Country]
Returns true if there is a revolutionary target in the world.
Returns true if the country has a ruler that is at least X years old. [Country]
[Country]
Returns true, if the country's ruler has the specified culture. Can utilise Event Scope Values. [Country]
Returns true if the country’s ruler has the specified personality. [Country]
Returns true if the country has foreign ruler. [Country]
Returns true, if the country's ruler has the specified religion. Can utilise Event Scope Values. [Country]
Returns true if the country has at least X sailors. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a sailor level of at least X%. [Country]
Returns true, if specified provinces are on the same continent. If used in country scope, capitals are checked. [Country / Province]
Returns true the secondary religion of the country is X. [Country]
Returns true if the country is the senior partner in a personal union over country X. [Country]
Returns true if the province is being besieged by country X. [Province]
Returns true, if the country has at least X splendor. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a stability of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the start date of the campaign is X. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the start date of the campaign is X or after. [Anywhere]
Returns true if Statists vs Orangists is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country receives subsidies of at least X% of its monthly income. [Country]
Returns true if the country has claimed the throne of the country X. [Country]
Returns true if the province belongs to the superregion X. [Province]
Returns true if the country is the specified country. [Country]
Returns true if the colonial nation pays at least X% tariffs. [Country]
Returns true if the ratio of tax income to total income is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the scoped country is at least X technologies ahead (compared to the country). [Country]
Returns true if the country has the technology group X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a tolerance of at least X towards the religion of the country or scoped province. [Country / Province]
Returns true if the base tax of the country's provinces totals at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a total development of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the total number of cardinals is at least X. [Anywhere]
Returns true if there are at least X transports in the province. [Province]
Returns true if the trade company has at least X provinces. [Province]
Returns true if the country has a trade efficiency over X. [Country]
Returns true if the country is embargoing country X. [Country]
Returns true if country X is embargoing the country. [Country]
Returns true if the ratio of trade income to total income is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the trade node is within the trade range of the specified country. [Province (Trade node)]
Returns true if the ratio of the transport fraction to the navy size of the country is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if country's treasury contains at least X ducats. [Country]
Returns true, if the country has a tribal allegiance of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a truce with X. [Country]
Returns true if any unit is in the province has a leader. Warning: Works only with 'yes'. [Province]
Returns true if any unit in the province is in a battle. [Province]
Returns true if any unit in the province is in a siege. [Province]
Returns true if there are at least X units in the province. [Province]
Returns true if the country has units of type X. [Country]
Returns true if the unrest in the province is at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the country uses authority mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses church aspects mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses blessings mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses cults mechanics. [Country]
Returns true, if the country uses devotion instead of legitimacy. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses doom mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses fervor mechanics. [Country]
Returns true, if the country uses the isolationism mechanic. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses karma mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses papacy mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses patriarch authority mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses personal deities mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses piety mechanics. [Country]
Returns true, if the country uses religious icons. [Country]
Returns true if the country uses syncretic faiths mechanics. [Country]
Returns true if the country is a vassal of country X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a war exhaustion of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the coutry has a warscore of at least X%. [Country]
Returns true if the country is at war with country X. [Country]
Returns false if the country was ever an end game tag i.e. a tag that is not intended to form another nation [Country]
Returns true if the country was controlled by a human player. [Country]
Returns true if the member of the HRE is backing the next imperial reform. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a yearly corruption increase of at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country's treasury contains ducats of at least X times their yearly income. [Country]

bracket.description: Returns true if the country has the specified attitude towards country X. [Country]
Returns true, if the country's army size is at least the size of X times the army size of the specified country. [Country]
Returns true if distance between the borders of the countries is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if at least "amount" number of targets within the specified scope match the specified conditions [Anywhere]
Returns true if distance between the capitals of the countries is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the specified variable is at least X.
Hides the enclosed condition so that it is still required but cannot be seen by human players and displays the specified tooltip in its place. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the country has employed an advisor with the specified characteristics. (Any combinations of type , home_religion and home_culture are permitted.) [Country]
Returns true if the estate X in the country has at least Y influence. [Country]
Returns true if the estate X in the country has at least Y loyalty. [Country]
Returns true if the estate X in the country controls at least Y% of the total development. [Country]
Returns true if the faction X of the country has at least Y influence. [Country]
Returns true, if the country still has and had the specified policy for at least X days. [Country]
Returns true if the consort flag X was last set at least Y days ago [Country]
Returns true if the country flag X was last set for the country at least Y days ago. [Country]
Returns true if the global flag X was last set at least Y days ago. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the heir flag X was last set at least Y days ago [Country]
Returns true if the province flag X was last set for the province at least Y days ago. [Province]
Returns true if the ruler flag X was last set for the current ruler at least Y days ago [Country]
Returns true if the country has a casus belli of type X against country Y. [Country]
Returns true if the disaster progress of the specified disaster is at least X in the country. [Country]
Returns true if the estate X in the country has the influence modifier Y. [Country]
Returns true if the estate X in the country has the loyalty modifier Y. [Country]
Returns true if the value of the specified modifier is at least X for the country. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a leader with at least the specified stats. admiral = yes and general = yes can be used as further limitation. [Country]
Returns true if the value of the specified modifier is at least X for the province. [Province]
Returns true if the country has at least "value" opinion of the country specified by "who". [Country]
Returns true if opinion difference between country X and Y, is at least Z [Country]
Returns true if the country has the opinion modifier "modifier" towards the country specified by "who". Can also specify a value of the modifier (but it is not displayed). [Country]
Returns true if the country X has a spy network of at least the specified size in the country. [Country]
Returns true if the country has a spy network of at least the specified size in country X. [Country]
Returns true the specified country has the trade modifier X in the trade node. [Province (Trade node)]
Hides the enclosed conditions so that they are still required but cannot be seen by human players. [Anywhere]
Returns true, if the value of the specified incident is at least X. [Country]
Returns true if the country has embraced at least X more institutions than the specified country. [Country]

Returns true if the country is at war and the mentioned conditions are fulfilled. Possible are: attacker_leader, defender_leader, casus_belli, defenders, attackers, participants, war_score, start_date, duration, war_goal_province. [Country]
Returns true if the specified variable is equal to X.
Returns true, if the country's military strength (army size & navy size combined) is at least the size of X times the military strength of the specified country [Country]
Returns true, if the country's navy size is at least the size of X times the navy size of the specified country. [Country]
Returns true if at least X provinces of the scoped country match the specified condition(s). [Country]

Float value: Returns true if the ratio of the provinces with the specified religion to the total provinces of the country is at least X. Integer value: Returns true if the country has at least X provinces with the specified religion. It is also possible to specify the secondary religion by secondary = yes . [Country]
Returns true if the specified country has at least X units of the specified type in the province. ( type and who are not needed, if not included will default to all.) [Province]
Returns true if the country has at least X trade power from privateering in the trade node. [Province (Trade node)]
Returns true if the country is the production leader of the trade good X. [Country]
Returns true, if the distance between specified provinces is at least X. [Province]
Returns true if the specified religion is enabled for at least X years. [Anywhere]
Returns true, if the country has the specified religious school. [Country]
Returns true if the country specified by "who" has at least "value" opinion of the country. [Country]
Returns true if the country specified by "who" has the opinion modifier "modifier" towards the country. Can also specify a value of the modifier (but it is not displayed). [Country]
Returns true if the country controls at least X% of the trade in the specified trade node. [Province (Trade node)]
Returns true if the country has the ‘trading in’ bonus of the specified trade good. [Country]
Returns true if the country has access to X% of the world market of the specified trade good. [Country]
Returns true, if the country has the specified trading policy in the specified trade node. Can also use "policy = any". [Country]
Returns true if the current scope has a trust level of at least X with the specified tag. [Country]

Can use variable effects and triggers to compare or change and compare modifier and trigger values. "variable_arithmetic_trigger" sections can include more "variable_arithmetic_trigger" sections. This has to be done for effects such as "change_variable" or effects of "if" sections inside the "variable_arithmetic_trigger", since the game may crash otherwise. [Anywhere]
Returns true if the coutry has a warscore of at least X against the specified country. [Country]
Returns true if the country is in a personal union under the specified country for at least X years. [Country]
Returns true if the country is a vassal of the specified country for at least X years. [Country]
